data.title: University of Illinois Chicago
data.text:
Student Center East Heading link

Student Center East

This Walter Netsch designed facility with modern updates sits at the “Front Door” to the East Campus. Located on Halsted St. just south of the Jane Adams Interchange; it affords sweeping views of the Chicago Skyline. This venue provides a variety of meeting rooms to fit just about any need. The Tower Rooms consist of 7 spaces, spread over three floors, housed at the north end of Student Center East.

SCE Fort Dearborn Room Heading link

Fort Dearborn AB is a horseshoe shaped space featuring a curved wall of art and low ceilings. A is an open space with access to Illinois C and overlooks the East Terrace. It is best used as a pre-function space or registration area. B, with its views of the inner campus and overlooking the West Terrace, works great as a breakout room accommodating up to 90 in an auditorium setting. Combined, Fort Dearborn is perfect for receptions and small gatherings.

Virtual Tours of SCE Fort Dearborn AB

Fort Dearborn Auditorium for 30 Virtual Tour

Fort Dearborn Classroom for 16 Virtual Tour

Fort Dearborn Conference Room for 12 Virtual Tour

SCE Illinois Room A, B & C Heading link

Illinois A, B & C create the largest space available in the venue. The soaring 20ft. high-ceiling rooms provide an open and spacious environment allowing for a variety of configurations. Illinois B & C feature floor to ceiling windows with northeast views of the city, with Illinois A featuring a blue-accented wall. Each room is equipped with built-in Audio and Visual components. The combination of Illinois A & B allows for auditorium seating for 500+ or dining for 300. Illinois C can host lectures for over 100 guests or a more intimate dinner setting for 56. Illinois B & C can be paired with a foyer allowing for registration or catering space. The rooms easily accommodate anything from medium sized productions to vendor/employment fairs.

Room arrangements and capacities are customized based on event.

SCE Monarch Room Heading link

This technology heavy room comes equipped with a Mondopad and features a built in computer. The elegant all-in-one touchscreen collaboration system allows for efficient face-to-face collaboration with people anywhere. Video conference, whiteboard, share data, and more — you’ll never want to meet without it. The soaring ceiling height and ribbon windows allow for natural light to bath the room complimenting the views of the Inner Campus. The space has a permanent set up of a conference table for 12 people with space on the side for additional seating.

SCE Dr. Henley Ballroom (Room 301) Heading link

This highly versatile space is always in high demand. Located on the 3rd floor of the Tower it provides sweeping views of both the north and south sides of the city. Its unique U shape allows registration tables and food service tables to be located in the space yet separate from the main area. Able to handle lectures up to 220 or dining for 120, this the perfect room to host your next meeting or formal dinner.

Virtual Tours of SCE Dr. Henley Ballroom (Room 301)

Dr. Henley Ballroom (Room 301) Rounds for 80 Virtual Tour

Dr. Henley Ballroom (Room 301) Auditorium for 100 Virtual Tour

Dr. Henley Ballroom (Room 301) Auditorium for 42 Virtual Tour

Dr. Henley Ballroom (Room 301) Classroom for 25 Virtual Tour

Dr. Henley Ballroom (Room 301) Conference Box for 24 Virtual Tour

SCE Meeting Room 605 Heading link

This generous-sized room anchors the 6th floor. Rectangular in shape with views of the north and south sides, it is perfect for medium-sized groups. The room can host lectures for 200, a classroom for 70, or meals for 120 guests. You can use the space as a keynote location by adding four other rooms on the floor.

Virtual Tours of SCE Meeting Room 605

Room 605 Auditorium for 70 Virtual Tour

Room 605 for 20 Virtual Tour

Room 605 Auditorium for 34 Virtual Tour

Room 605 Conference Box for 20 Virtual Tour

SCE Meeting Rooms 613/713 Heading link

SCE Meeting Rooms 613 & 713

These medium-sized spaces come with a mirrored wall perfect for dance classes. Windows on the north and south allow natural light to fill the space. These rooms provide you with enough space to do various configurations. An auditorium for 80, a classroom for 50, a conference table for 40, or dinner for 60 are all available in this room.

Room 613 for 24 Virtual Tour
